Company Description
At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.
We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.
Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.
Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.
We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.
You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.
We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.
We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.
When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.
Job Description
AECOM is seeking a R2A Sr. Specialist - Joint Venture to be based in Manila, Philippines.
This role is primarily responsible for maintaining multiple joint venture financial books with varied difficulty, from simple to moderately complex accounts.
Responsibilities and Duties:
Perform multiple financial statements with varied complexity, which may include AP/AR, projects and general ledgers, month-end accruals, and reporting packages.
Process invoices, payments, and monthly journal entries.
Monitor, analyze, and reconcile various moderately complex balance sheet accounts.
Working with a wide range of internal customers to gather and provide information
Prepare varied departmental reports and reconciliations.
Escalate issues and recommend resolutions to the team lead for timely resolution. May support junior members of the team in addressing routine issues within the assigned processes.
Maintain the SOP/DTP of current processes and incorporate documentation updates as required.
Perform moderately complex tasks in compliance with service level agreements, processes, policies, and procedures.
Propose alternatives to identified issues and assist in investigating and resolving common and unusual issues.
Contribute to various and simultaneous process improvement initiatives to streamline processes, improve the customer experience, and increase productivity.
Participate in audit-related activities.
Contribute specialized expertise to different assigned projects and may provide key updates to the team lead and manager.
Qualifications
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting/Finance or equivalent relevant courses
4-5 years of relevant professional experience in Finance or Accounting
Intermediate proficiency in MS Office tools
Working knowledge and understanding of accounting and financial reporting in US GAAP, finance procedures and internal controls.
Experience working with Oracle and Oracle Financial Reporting System is an advantage but is not required
Attributes:
Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate within a varied audience and internal and external customers. (Communication)
Ability to maintain good customer relationship with the ability to suggest ways to improve customer support customer experience (Customer Service)
Ability to be thorough and meticulous in completing assigned tasks and identifying errors, duplicates, & discrepancies through defined methods. (Attention to Detail)
Ability to identify and resolve simple to moderate with the ability to provide resolution alternatives by following defined policies and procedures. (Problem Solving)

Job Description
AECOM is seeking a Tax Compliance Specialist (ANZ) to be based in Manila, Philippines.
This Tax Compliance Specialist contributes mainly to performing periodic, annual, and ad hoc tax activities in accordance with the tax compliance of various countries, such as Australia and New Zealand, generally accepted accounting principles, finance policies, and internal controls. The role performs analytical processes under the direct supervision of AU onshore stakeholders and collaborates with various departments in completing the work assigned.
Australia and New Zealand Tax
Prepares assigned quarterly tax effect accounting entries and statutory tax notes.
Process and prepare lodgment of corporate tax returns, payroll tax obligations, and partnership tax returns.
Managing the GST position, including the preparation and lodgement of the business activity statements (BAS) and the arrangement of GST payments.
Prepare a fringe benefits tax (FBT) return, including an analysis of tax-sensitive accounts and the determination of appropriate tax treatment.
Support the manager in administering intercompany agreements and withholding tax positions.
Maintain a tax-fixed asset register.
Others
Assists during tax audits through obtaining invoices and supporting information from the system.
Completes research to support tax issues and new projects; escalates findings to the tax manager
Provide regular task updates with local and onshore managers through weekly meetings.
Escalates and analyzes identified process issues and concerns to the Manila Tax Manager for timely resolution.
Maintain current processes and incorporate documentation updates as required; work with the onshore manager in establishing tax compliance processes.
Collaborates with the onshore manager in establishing the tax compliance process; supports selected simple process improvement initiatives to streamline processes.
Perform simple but varied tasks in compliance with service level agreements, processes, policies, and procedures.

Job Description
AECOM is seeking a Lead - Financial Accountant to be based in Manila, Philippines
This role is primarily responsible for autonomously performing periodic financial transactions and ad hoc tax activities in accordance with tax compliance, generally accepted accounting principles, finance policies, and internal controls. The role is expected to provide technical expertise and lead junior team members in ensuring alignment in financial procedures, processes, and systems to business requirements.
Responsibilities & Duties
Assumes responsibility in the maintaining financial management and reporting systems and complementary financial and administrative business processes, to support the effective and judicious use of financial resources.
Leads in the maintenance of a documented system of accounting process, policies and procedures like SOP and DTPs, including the maintenance of the Fixed Asset register and management of the Blackline Reconciliation.
Demonstrates adept knowledge of the organization’s financial policies, procedures, processes, systems and supporting technology.
Applies expertise in processing financial transactions to ensure the effective recording and tracking of revenues and expenditures.
Prepares journal entries and synthesize common ledger for subsidiary accounts.
Performs complex tasks in compliance with process, policies, procedures, and SOX & internal controls.
Resolves identified issues independently and keeps the Finance Manager updated for open or ongoing concerns.
Addresses critical and unique issues with the guidance of Finance Manager for timely resolution of escalated issues.
Prepares financial reports and final accounts in compliance with statutory/regulatory requirements and general accepted accounting standards autonomously.
Leads with monthly closings, account analysis and supports the Finance Manager in carrying out the responsibilities of the Business Office
Develops and prepare reports, analyses, and presentations for periodic and ad hoc requirements.
Drives completion of audit processes by coordinating with stakeholders, join auditors in walk throughs, and review submitted documents.
Leads and support key projects, audit reviews, activities, and documentation.
Recommends process and procedural improvements to maintain the accuracy and integrity of financial transactions.
Works with Finance Manager to develop process improvement initiatives to streamline processes, improve customer experience, and increase productivity.
Identifies risks and propose ways to prevent occurrence of similar issues and concerns.
Applies expert knowledge on relevant local, state, and federal tax laws and regulations in managing taxation and tax-related issues.
Demonstrates in-depth knowledge in the specific areas of tax, duties, and government levies.
Ensures compliance with Philippine regulatory reporting requirements such as BIR, SEC, and BOI.
Identifies potential tax exposure and advises accordingly. Advise on the impact of changes in tax laws on the organization. Explains the organization’s tax policies and plays a key role in their implementation.
Provides guidance and technical expertise to junior members of the team in completing projects and performing financial activities.
Qualifications
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in accounting/finance or equivalent relevant courses
5+ years of relevant professional experience in Finance or Accounting
Advanced proficiency in MS Office tools
Advanced knowledge and understanding of accounting standards and procedures and internal controls.
Experience working with ERP, e.i., Oracle and Blackline Systems is an advantage or other similar platforms and tools
Attributes:
Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate within a varied audience and internal and external customers. (Communication)
Ability to maintain good customer relationship with the ability to initiate ways to improve customer experience (Customer Service)
Ability to be thorough and meticulous in completing assigned tasks and with the ability to propose ways to prevent or eliminate errors, discrepancies & issues. (Attention to Detail)
Ability to identify and resolve moderate and complex issues by applying best practices and technical expertise and may recommend solutions for unique scenarios. (Problem Solving)

Job Description
AECOM is seeking a Senior Graphic Designer to be based in Manila, Philippines.
This role is primarily responsible for the development of visual communications, visual strategy execution of complex project requirements, and delivery of appropriate creative design concepts for internal and external presentations and campaigns across print and digital platforms. This includes the overall layout, design, and production activities and contributing to the development of new concepts, graphic standards and templates, and improved processes and workflow system.
Manage end-to-end graphic design production efforts including graphic design of qualifications, proposals, presentations, marketing collaterals
Execute design concepts to support marketing campaigns and social media campaigns
Lay out bid documents, capability statements and other work winning materials
Design executive presentations, infographics, invitations, conference, event materials, brochures, interactive PDFs, video contents, and other printed collaterals for internal and external use
Manage the upload and maintenance of the project and staff photography library
Research and develop new ways of presenting our brand
Create and edit materials for large events and campaigns
Manage AECOM’s internal photography library. Images are obtained through royalty-free purchase, company’s image collection, and/or creation of original artwork
Apply technical knowledge and work with senior members of the team in managing complex projects and developing process improvement and initiatives
Assist the Team Lead in managing team workload and performing quality checks on output of junior members of the team prior to submission to stakeholders and clients
Address critical and unique issues, identify risks, and propose ways to prevent occurrence of similar issues and concerns
Lead and support key projects and provide guidance and technical expertise to junior members of the team

Bachelor’s degree in any four-year course, preferably in Graphic Arts, Design, Communications, and other similar courses
At least five (5) years of experience in a corporate environment, outsourcing, shared services, or similar model within Graphic Design function or any other relevant roles and functions
A portfolio that demonstrates a solid background in print, editorial or brochure design
A strong understanding and creative approach to brand identity and visual aesthetics
Experience in developing innovative design concepts, project management, taking briefs, and print production experience
Advanced proficiency in MS Word, MS PowerPoint and Adobe Creative Suite including InDesign, Illustrator, and Photoshop
Experience using After Effects and Premier or other similar tools and platforms is preferred
Ability to provide multimedia work including animation is preferred
Experience in creating collaterals in different languages is preferred

Ability to maintain a high level of collaboration among multiple internal and external stakeholders to effectively arrive at solutions and develop initiatives. (Collaboration)
